intro: Selago inaequifolia, commonly known as the unequal-leaved selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often of unequal size on the same stem. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in racemes, and it produces small, red berries that are a source of food for various animals. Selago inaequifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
